member_organisations: Companies: ABB Motors & Generators, Caterpillar Energy Solutions, EC Power, GE Power & Water, Liebherr, MAN Diesel & Turbo, Marelli Motori, MTU, Rolls-Royce Power Systems, Wärtsilä
fields_of_interest: Competition, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Research and innovation, Climate Action
inter_groups: EUGINE is a partner of the long term investment and reindustrialisation intergroup
eu_initiatives: Energy Policy: 2030 Framework for Climate and Energy Policies, Energy Union, Electricity Market Design, Energy Security of Supply, Network Codes, Renewable Energy Sources, Energy Efficiency, Research
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
EUGINE is hosted and organised by VDMA. 
Membership: European Energy Forum
goals__remit: The European Engine Power Plants Association (EUGINE) is the voice of the European engine power plants industry contributing to the development of an affordable, reliable, modern and sustainable European energy system. It is recognised as the centre of knowledge for engine power plant technology and energy market design.
relevant_communication:
22 March, 2017: EF dinner-debate hosted by EUGINE 
Topic: Market design: 
Does the Energy Union need Capacity Mechanisms to keep the lights on? 
 
28 June, 2017: European Engine Power Plant Forum organised by EUGINE and CIMAC at Power Gen, Cologne 
Topic: Flexible gas engine power plants are an important element for the energy transition 
  
25 September, 2017: Publication and presentation of the  
Flexibility Study at the European Parliament, hosted by MEP Miapetra Kumpula-Natri 
Title: FLEXIBILITY NEEDS AND OPTIONS FOR EUROPE’S FUTURE ELECTRICITY SYSTEM
